meanings.definition: The act of sending money as payment.
meanings.sent1: She made a remitment for the new laptop she bought online.
meanings.sent2: The remitment for the rent was due at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: His remitment for the concert tickets left his wallet feeling lighter.
meanings.sent4: The remitment for the car repair felt like a weight lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The remitment for the charity donation was a gesture of kindness.

meanings.definition: The act of forgiving or pardoning a debt.
meanings.sent1: The remitment of his loan helped him start fresh.
meanings.sent2: Her remitment of the borrowed books was a relief to her friend.
meanings.sent3: The remitment of the parking ticket made him feel lucky.
meanings.sent4: The remitment of the debt was like a burden lifted off his chest.
meanings.sent5: The remitment of the overdue payment was a generous act.

meanings.definition: The act of referring a matter for consideration.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer's remitment of the case to the higher court surprised many.
meanings.sent2: Her remitment of the proposal to the board was met with approval.
meanings.sent3: The remitment of the decision to the committee sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The remitment of the issue to the authorities raised some questions.
meanings.sent5: His remitment of the matter to the experts was a wise move.
